017package org.microbean.loader;
018
019import java.lang.reflect.Type;
020
021import java.util.NoSuchElementException;
022import java.util.Properties;
023
024import java.util.function.Supplier;
025
026import org.microbean.loader.api.Loader;
027
028import org.microbean.loader.spi.AbstractProvider;
029import org.microbean.loader.spi.Value;
030
031import org.microbean.path.Path;
032import org.microbean.path.Path.Element;
033
034import org.microbean.qualifier.Qualifiers;
035
036import org.microbean.type.JavaTypes;
037
038/**
039 * An {@link AbstractProvider} that can return {@link Value}s backed
040 * by System properties.
041 *
042 * <p>While System properties are often casually assumed to be stable
043 * and {@link String}-typed, the exact opposite is true: System
044 * properties may contain arbitrarily-typed {@link Object}s under
045 * arbitrarily-typed keys, and the properties themselves {@linkplain
046 * System#setProperties(Properties) may be replaced} at any point.
047 * This means that all {@link Value}s supplied by this {@link
048 * SystemPropertyProvider} are {@linkplain Value#determinism()
049 * non-deterministic} and may change type and presence from one call
050 * to another.</p>
051 *
052 * <p>It is also worth mentioning explicitly that, deliberately, no
053 * type conversion of any System property value takes place in this
054 * class.</p>
055 *
056 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
057 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
058 *
059 * @see System#getProperty(String, String)
060 *
061 * @see System#getProperties()
062 *
063 * @see System#setProperties(Properties)
064 *
065 * @see Properties#getProperty(String, String)
066 *
067 * @see Value#determinism()
068 */
069public final class SystemPropertyProvider extends AbstractProvider {
070
071
072  /*
073   * Constructors.
074   */
075
076
077  /**
078   * Creates a new {@link SystemPropertyProvider}.
079   */
080  public SystemPropertyProvider() {
081    super();
082  }
083
084
085  /*
086   * Instance methods.
087   */
088
089
090  /**
091   * Returns a {@link Value} suitable for the System property
092   * represented by the supplied {@link Path}.
093   *
094   * <p>This method never returns {@code null}.  Its overrides may if
095   * they wish.</p>
096   *
097   * <p>The {@linkplain Path.Element#name() name} of the {@linkplain
098   * Path#lastElement() last element} of the supplied {@link Path} is
099   * taken to be the name of the System property value to retrieve.
100   * If the {@linkplain JavaTypes#erase(Type) type erasure} of the
101   * supplied {@link Path}'s {@link Path#qualified() qualified()}
102   * method {@linkplain Class#isAssignableFrom(Class) is assignable
103   * from} {@link String String.class}, then calls will be made by the
104   * returned {@link Value}'s {@link Value#get() get()} method to
105   * {@link System#getProperty(String)} before simple calls to {@link
106   * Properties#get(String) System.getProperties().get(String)}.</p>
107   *
108   * <p>Any {@link Value} returned by this method will have no
109   * {@linkplain Value#Value(Value, Supplier)
110   * defaults}, a {@link Qualifiers} equal to the return value of
111   * {@link Qualifiers#of()}, a ({@linkplain Path#absolute()
112   * relative}) {@link Path} equal to the supplied {@code
113   * absolutePath}'s {@linkplain Path#lastElement() last element}, a
114   * {@link Supplier} that is backed by System property access
115   * machinery, and a value of {@link
116   * org.microbean.invoke.OptionalSupplier.Determinism#NON_DETERMINISTIC}
117   * for its {@linkplain Value#determinism() determinism property}.
118   * If the supplied {@link Path}'s {@linkplain Path#qualified() type}
119   * is not assignable from that borne by a System property value,
120   * then the {@link Value} will return {@code null} from its {@link
121   * Value#get() get()} method in such a case, indicating that the
122   * value is present but cannot be represented.  Overrides are
123   * strongly encouraged to abide by these conditions.</p>
124   *
125   * @param requestor the {@link Loader} seeking a {@link Value}; must
126   * not be {@code null}
127   *
128   * @param absolutePath an {@linkplain Path#absolute() absolute
129   * <code>Path</code>} for which a {@link Value} is being sought;
130   * must not be {@code null}
131   *
132   * @return a {@link Value} suitable for the System property whose
133   * name is represented by the supplied {@link Path}'s {@linkplain
134   * Path#lastElement() last <code>Element</code>}'s {@linkplain
135   * Path.Element#name() name}
136   *
137   * @exception NullPointerException if an argument for either
138   * parameter is {@code null}
139   *
140   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null} but its
141   * overrides may.
142   *
143   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
144   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
145   *
146   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
147   * Overrides must be idempotent, but need not be deterministic.
148   * {@link Value}s returned by this method or its overrides are
149   * <em>not</em> guaranteed to be idempotent or deterministic.
150   */
151  @Override // AbstractProvider<Object>
152  public Value<?> get(final Loader<?> requestor, final Path<? extends Type> absolutePath) {
153    assert absolutePath.absolute();
154    assert absolutePath.startsWith(requestor.path());
155    assert !absolutePath.equals(requestor.path());
156
157    if (absolutePath.size() == 2) { // root + name
158      final Element<? extends Type> last = absolutePath.lastElement();
159      final String name = last.name();
160      if (!name.isEmpty()) {
161        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
162        final Class<?> pathTypeErasure = JavaTypes.erase(absolutePath.qualified());
163        final Supplier<?> s;
164        if (CharSequence.class.isAssignableFrom(pathTypeErasure)) {
165          s = () -> getCharSequenceAssignableSystemProperty(name, pathTypeErasure);
166        } else {
167          s = () -> getSystemProperty(name, pathTypeErasure);
168        }
169        return new Value<>(s, Path.of(last));
170      }
171    }
172    return null;
173  }
174
175  private static final <T> T getCharSequenceAssignableSystemProperty(final String propertyName, final Class<T> typeErasure) {
176    assert CharSequence.class.isAssignableFrom(typeErasure) : "typeErasure: " + typeErasure.getName();
177    Object value = System.getProperty(propertyName);
178    if (value == null) {
179      final Properties systemProperties = System.getProperties();
180      value = systemProperties.getProperty(propertyName);
181      if (value == null) {
182        value = systemProperties.get(propertyName);
183      }
184    }
185    if (typeErasure.isInstance(value)) {
186      return typeErasure.cast(value);
187    }
188    throw new NoSuchElementException(propertyName);
189  }
190
191  private static final <T> T getSystemProperty(final String propertyName, final Class<T> typeErasure) {
192    assert !CharSequence.class.isAssignableFrom(typeErasure) : "typeErasure: " + typeErasure.getName();
193    final Object value = System.getProperties().get(propertyName);
194    if (typeErasure.isInstance(value)) {
195      return typeErasure.cast(value);
196    }
197    throw new NoSuchElementException(propertyName);
198  }
199
200}
